title: Amulet of rage
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| Type | Jewellery                                                                          |
| :--- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Amulet of rage                                                                     |
| Icon | [![Amulet of rage.png](/images/d/dd/Amulet_of_rage.png)](/File:Amulet_of_rage.png) |

|   |                                                                                |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | An amulet that enables its wearer to attempt to enter a state of berserk rage. |

Wearing an **amulet of rage** allows you to go [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") at will. This vastly increases your combat capabilities for a short while, but leaves you penalized afterwards (see the [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") article for more details).

> **Success Rate**: 50 + 2×[Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations") > (3d100)/3  
> **Cost**: 2 MP, and you lose 600 [nutrition](/Nutrition "Nutrition") when it ends

[![Rage evoc.png](/images/c/c3/Rage_evoc.png)](/File:Rage_evoc.png)

[Formicids](/Formicid "Formicid"), [mummies](/Mummies "Mummies"), and [ghouls](/Ghoul "Ghoul") can never go berserk, and thus have no use for this amulet. Bloodless [Vampires](/Vampire "Vampire") also cannot go berserk, nor can other species that are Starving. [Cheibriados](/Cheibriados "Cheibriados") disapproves of going berserk and will impose [penance](/Penance "Penance") upon followers that do so.

## Strategy

For users with a decent Evocations skill, this amulet is a reliable and renewable source of berserking. For non-[Trog](/Trog "Trog") followers, this is amazingly useful, especially in the early game. Even without Evocations skill, however, it is far from useless; at no skill, you have a 50% chance of activating it. Simply start making activation attempts when the enemy is two or three tiles away, and if you activate early, simply pass a turn or move to meet it. This will reduce the duration of your berserk slightly, but you should still have plenty of time to crush your opponent. See the [Berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") article for advice on intelligent berserking.

Be aware that monsters can use amulets of rage against you, if they happened to find one somewhere.

## History

- Amulets of rage were removed in [0.25](/0.25 "0.25").
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), wearing this amulet had a tiny chance of extending your berserk each time you killed an enemy.
- Prior to [0.11](/0.11 "0.11"), this amulet also decreased the odds of you passing out after your berserk state ends.

| [Jewellery](/Jewellery "Jewellery") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

| [Rings](/Ring "Ring")               | [Dexterity](/Ring_of_dexterity "Ring of dexterity") • [Evasion](/Ring_of_evasion "Ring of evasion") • [Fire](/Ring_of_fire "Ring of fire") • [Flight](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight") • [Ice](/Ring_of_ice "Ring of ice") • [Intelligence](/Ring_of_intelligence "Ring of intelligence") • [Magical power](/Ring_of_magical_power "Ring of magical power") • [Poison resistance](/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance") • [Positive energy](/Ring_of_positive_energy "Ring of positive energy") • [Protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection") • [Protection from cold](/Ring_of_protection_from_cold "Ring of protection from cold") • [Protection from fire](/Ring_of_protection_from_fire "Ring of protection from fire") • [Resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion") • [See invisible](/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible") • [Slaying](/Ring_of_slaying "Ring of slaying") • [Strength](/Ring_of_strength "Ring of strength") • [Willpower](/Ring_of_willpower "Ring of willpower") • [Wizardry](/Ring_of_wizardry "Ring of wizardry") |

Amulet of rage

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Type Jewellery
Name Amulet of rage
Icon
An amulet that enables its wearer to attempt to enter a state of berserk rage.

Wearing an amulet of rage allows you to go berserk at will. This vastly increases your combat capabilities for a short while, but leaves you penalized afterwards (see the berserk article for more details).

Success Rate: 50 + 2×Evocations > (3d100)/3
Cost: 2 MP, and you lose 600 nutrition when it ends

Formicids, mummies, and ghouls can never go berserk, and thus have no use for this amulet. Bloodless Vampires also cannot go berserk, nor can other species that are Starving. Cheibriados disapproves of going berserk and will impose penance upon followers that do so.

Strategy

For users with a decent Evocations skill, this amulet is a reliable and renewable source of berserking. For non-Trog followers, this is amazingly useful, especially in the early game. Even without Evocations skill, however, it is far from useless; at no skill, you have a 50% chance of activating it. Simply start making activation attempts when the enemy is two or three tiles away, and if you activate early, simply pass a turn or move to meet it. This will reduce the duration of your berserk slightly, but you should still have plenty of time to crush your opponent. See the Berserk article for advice on intelligent berserking.

Be aware that monsters can use amulets of rage against you, if they happened to find one somewhere.

History

  • Amulets of rage were removed in 0.25.
  • Prior to 0.15, wearing this amulet had a tiny chance of extending your berserk each time you killed an enemy.
  • Prior to 0.11, this amulet also decreased the odds of you passing out after your berserk state ends.
